info.title: Twilio SendGrid Legacy Marketing Campaigns Contacts API
info.summary: The Twilio SendGrid Legacy Marketing Campaigns Contacts API allows you to manage your marketing contacts programmatically. SendGrid recommends [moving to the latest version of Marketing Campaigns](https://docs.sendgrid.com/ui/sending-email/migrating-from-legacy-marketing-campaigns) if you are using this API.
info.description:
The Twilio SendGrid Legacy Marketing Campaigns Contacts API allows you to manage your marketing contacts programmatically. This API is operational, but we recommend using the current version of Marketing Campaigns' [Contacts API](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/contacts/), [Lists API](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/lists/), and [Segments API](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/segmenting-contacts-v2/) to manage your contacts.

See [**Migrating from Legacy Marketing Campaigns**](https://docs.sendgrid.com/ui/sending-email/migrating-from-legacy-marketing-campaigns) for more information.

post.description:
**This endpoint allows you to create a custom field.**

**You can create up to 120 custom fields.**

400.description: The request was formatted incorrectly or missing required parameters.

errors.message: Returned if request body is invalid JSON
Returned if custom field type is invalid or not provided
Returned if custom field name is not provided

get.description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve all custom fields.**

parameters.name: custom_field_id
parameters.description: The ID of the custom field that you want to retrieve.

get.description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve a custom field by ID.**

errors.message: Custom field ID does not exist

delete.description: **This endpoint allows you to delete a custom field by ID.**

400.description: The `custom_field_id` is not valid

errors.message: Custom field in use by one or more segment conditions
Custom field ID does not exist
Custom field ID does not exist

post.description: **This endpoint allows you to create a list for your recipients.**

400.description: The request was formatted incorrectly or missing required parameters.

errors.message: Returned if request body is invalid JSON
Returned if list name is not a string
Returned if list name is a duplicate of an existing list or segment

get.description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of your recipient lists. If you don't have any lists, an empty array will be returned.**

delete.description: **This endpoint allows you to delete multiple recipient lists.**

400.description: All list ids are not valid

get.description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve a single recipient list.**

400.description: Provided `list_id` is not valid

patch.description: **This endpoint allows you to update the name of one of your recipient lists.**

name.description: The new name for your list.
The new name for the list

recipient_count.description: The number of recipients on the list

400.description: The request was formatted incorrectly or missing required parameters.

delete.description: **This endpoint allows you to delete a specific recipient list with the given ID.**

parameters.name: delete_contacts
parameters.description: Adds the ability to delete all contacts on the list in addition to deleting the list.

400.description: Returned if `list_id` or `delete_contacts` are not valid

errors.message: Returned if list_id is not valid

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: The id of the list of recipients you want to retrieve.

get.summary: Retrieve all recipients on a List
get.description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve all recipients on the list with the given ID.**

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page index of first recipient to return (must be a positive integer)

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of recipients to return at a time (must be a positive integer between 1 and 1000)

400.description: Input failed validation

errors.message: Returned if list_id is not a valid integer
Returned if page is not a valid integer
Returned if page is less than 1
Returned if page_size is not a valid integer
Returned if page_size is less than 1 or greater than 1000

post.summary: Add Multiple Recipients to a List
post.description:
**This endpoint allows you to add multiple recipients to a list.**

Adds existing recipients to a list, passing in the recipient IDs to add. Recipient IDs should be passed exactly as they are returned from recipient endpoints.

400.description: The request was formatted incorrectly or missing required parameters.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: The ID of the list that you want to add the recipient to.

parameters.name: recipient_id
parameters.description: The ID of the recipient you are adding to the list.

post.summary: Add a Single Recipient to a List
post.description: **This endpoint allows you to add a single recipient to a list.**

400.description: Input failed validation

errors.message: Returned if list_id does not exist
Returned if recipient_id does not exist

delete.summary: Delete a Single Recipient from a Single List
delete.description: **This endpoint allows you to delete a single recipient from a list.**

400.description: Input failed validation

404.description: Returned if list_id or recipient_id does not exist

errors.message: Returned if list_id does not exist
Returned if recipient_id does not exist

post.description:
**This endpoint allows you to add a Marketing Campaigns recipient.**

You can add custom field data as a parameter on this endpoint. We have provided an example using some of the default custom fields SendGrid provides.

The rate limit is three requests every 2 seconds. You can upload 1000  contacts per request. So the maximum upload rate is 1500 recipients per second.

email.description: The email address of the recipient.

first_name.description: The first name of the recipient.

last_name.description: The last name of the recipient.

400.description: The request body is not valid json

errors.message: Request body is not valid json

patch.description:
**This endpoint allows you to update one or more recipients.**

The body of an API call to this endpoint must include an array of one or more recipient objects.

It is of note that you can add custom field data as parameters on recipient objects. We have provided an example using some of the default custom fields SendGrid provides.

last_name.description: The last name of the recipient. This is one of the default custom fields.

first_name.description: The first name of the recipient. This is one of the default custom fields.

400.description: The request body is not valid json

errors.message: Request body is not valid json

delete.description:
**This endpoint allows you to deletes one or more recipients.**

The body of an API call to this endpoint must include an array of recipient IDs of the recipients you want to delete.

400.description: The request was formatted incorrectly or missing required parameters.

get.description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of your Marketing Campaigns recipients.**

Batch deletion of a page makes it possible to receive an empty page of recipients before reaching the end of
the list of recipients. To avoid this issue; iterate over pages until a 404 is retrieved.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page index of first recipients to return (must be a positive integer)

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of recipients to return at a time (must be a positive integer between 1 and 1000)

400.description: Input failed validation

parameters.name: recipient_id
parameters.description: The ID of the recipient that you want to retrieve.

get.description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve a single recipient by ID from your contact database.**

400.description: Returned if `recipient_id` is not valid

404.description: A record for that recipient id does not exist

delete.description:
**This endpoint allows you to delete a single recipient with the given ID from your contact database.**

> Use this to permanently delete your recipients from all of your contact lists and all segments if required by applicable law.

400.description: Returned if `recipient_id` is not valid

404.description: A record for that recipient id does not exist

parameters.name: recipient_id
parameters.description: The ID of the recipient for whom you are retrieving lists.

get.summary: Retrieve the lists that a recipient is on
get.description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve the lists that a given recipient belongs to.**

Each recipient can be on many lists. This endpoint gives you all of the lists that any one recipient has been added to.

400.description: Returned if `recipient_id` is not valid

404.description: Returned if a record for the recipient id does not exist

get.summary: Retrieve the count of billable recipients
get.description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve the number of Marketing Campaigns recipients that you will be billed for.**

You are billed for marketing campaigns based on the highest number of recipients you have had in your account at one time. This endpoint will allow you to know the current billable count value.
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve the total number of Marketing Campaigns recipients.**

**This endpoint allows you to perform a search on all of your Marketing Campaigns recipients.**

field_name:

* is a variable that is substituted for your actual custom field name from your recipient.
* Text fields must be url-encoded. Date fields are searchable only by unix timestamp (e.g. 2/2/2015 becomes 1422835200)
* If field_name is a 'reserved' date field, such as created_at or updated_at, the system will internally convert
your epoch time to a date range encompassing the entire day. For example, an epoch time of 1422835600 converts to
Mon, 02 Feb 2015 00:06:40 GMT, but internally the system will search from Mon, 02 Feb 2015 00:00:00 GMT through
Mon, 02 Feb 2015 23:59:59 GMT.

400.description: The request was formatted incorrectly or missing required parameters.

errors.message: The following parameters are not custom fields or reserved fields: [{field_name}]

post.description:
Search using segment conditions without actually creating a segment.
Body contains a JSON object with `conditions`, a list of conditions as described below, and an optional `list_id`, which is a valid list ID for a list to limit the search on.

Valid operators for create and update depend on the type of the field for which you are searching.

- Dates:
  - `"eq"`, `"ne"`, `"lt"` (before), `"gt"` (after)
    - You may use MM/DD/YYYY for day granularity or an epoch for second granularity.
  - `"empty"`, `"not_empty"`
  - `"is within"`
    - You may use an [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date format or the # of days.
- Text: `"contains"`, `"eq"` (is - matches the full field), `"ne"` (is not - matches any field where the entire field is not the condition value), `"empty"`, `"not_empty"`
- Numbers: `"eq"`, `"lt"`, `"gt"`, `"empty"`, `"not_empty"`
- Email Clicks and Opens: `"eq"` (opened), `"ne"` (not opened)

Field values must all be a string.

Search conditions using `"eq"` or `"ne"` for email clicks and opens should provide a "field" of either `clicks.campaign_identifier` or `opens.campaign_identifier`.

The condition value should be a string containing the id of a completed campaign.

Search conditions list may contain multiple conditions, joined by an `"and"` or `"or"` in the `"and_or"` field.

The first condition in the conditions list must have an empty `"and_or"`, and subsequent conditions must all specify an `"and_or"`.

conditions.description: The conditions by which this segment should be created.

get.description: **This endpoint allows you to list all fields that are reserved and can't be used for custom field names.**

post.description:
**This endpoint allows you to create a new segment.**


  Valid operators for create and update depend on the type of the field for which you are searching.

**Dates**
- "eq", "ne", "lt" (before), "gt" (after)
    - You may use MM/DD/YYYY for day granularity or an epoch for second granularity.
- "empty", "not_empty"
- "is within"
    - You may use an [ISO 8601 date format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) or the # of days.

**Text**
- "contains"
- "eq" (is/equals - matches the full field)
- "ne" (is not/not equals - matches any field where the entire field is not the condition value)
- "empty"
- "not_empty"

**Numbers**
- "eq" (is/equals)
- "lt" (is less than)
- "gt" (is greater than)
- "empty"
- "not_empty"

**Email Clicks and Opens**
- "eq" (opened)
- "ne" (not opened)

All field values must be a string.


Conditions using "eq" or "ne" for email clicks and opens should provide a "field" of either `clicks.campaign_identifier` or `opens.campaign_identifier`.
The condition value should be a string containing the id of a completed campaign.


The conditions list may contain multiple conditions, joined by an "and" or "or" in the "and_or" field.

The first condition in the conditions list must have an empty "and_or", and subsequent conditions must all specify an "and_or".

400.description: The request was formatted incorrectly or missing required parameters.

errors.message: request body is not valid json
invalid value is passed into one of the request body parameters
field and set value is not passed into the request body
value and set value is not passed into the request body
operator and set value is not passed into the request body
and_or is not set on more than one condition and less than all conditions
and_or is set on all conditions
and_or is set on the only condition passed
and_or and set value is not passed into the request body

get.description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of your segments.**
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve a single segment with the given ID.**

400.description: The segment_id is not valid

patch.description: **This endpoint allows you to update a segment.**

list_id.description: The list ID you would like this segment to be built from.

conditions.description: The conditions by which this segment should be created.

errors.message: request body is not valid json
invalid value is passed into one of the request body parameters
field and set value is not passed into the request body
value and set value is not passed into the request body
operator and set value is not passed into the request body
and_or is not set on more than one condition and less than all conditions
and_or is set on all conditions
and_or is set on the only condition passed
and_or and set value is not passed into the request body

delete.description:
**This endpoint allows you to delete a segment from your recipients database.**

You also have the option to delete all the contacts from your Marketing Campaigns recipient database who were in this segment.

parameters.name: delete_contacts
parameters.description: True to delete all contacts matching the segment in addition to deleting the segment

400.description: Either segment_id or delete_contacts is not valid

errors.message: Returned if segment_id is not valid
Returned if delete_contacts is not a valid boolean

parameters.name: segment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the segment from which you want to retrieve recipients.

get.description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of the recipients in a segment with the given ID.**

schema.title: List Recipients On a Segment response

400.description: Input failed validation

404.description: The segment_id is not valid or does not exist

get.description: **This endpoint allows you to check the upload status of a Marketing Campaigns recipient.**

id.description: Valid values are "worker_delay" and "worker_delay_seconds" (the second value appears only if "worker_delay" has a value of "delayed").

value.description: Valid values for the ID "worker_delay" are "OK" or "Delayed". Valid values for the ID "worker_delay_seconds" is the time of delay to upload.

ContactdbCustomFieldId2xx.title: ContactDB Custom field schema with ID.

id.description: The ID of the custom field.
The reference ID of your list.

name.description: The name of your list. Must be unique against all other list and segment names.

recipient_count.description: The count of recipients currently in the list.

id.description: The ID of the custom field.

value.description: The value of this recipient's custom field

created_at.description: The time this record was created in your contactdb, in unixtime.

custom_fields.description: The custom fields assigned to this recipient and their values.

email.description: The email address of this recipient. This is a default custom field that SendGrid provides.

first_name.description: The first name of this recipient. This is a default custom field that SendGrid provides.

last_name.description: The last name of the recipient.

last_clicked.description: The last time this recipient clicked a link from one of your campaigns, in unixtime.

last_emailed.description: The last time this user was emailed by one of your campaigns, in unixtime.

last_opened.description: The last time this recipient opened an email from you, in unixtime.

updated_at.description: The last update date for this recipient's record.

error_count.description: The number of errors found while adding recipients.

error_indices.description: The indices of the recipient(s) sent that caused the error.

new_count.description: The count of new recipients added to the contactdb.

persisted_recipients.description: The recipient IDs of the recipients that already existed from this request.

updated_count.description: The recipients who were updated from this request.

list_id.description: The list id from which to make this segment. Not including this ID will mean your segment is created from the main contactdb rather than a list.

conditions.description: The conditions for a recipient to be included in this segment.

recipient_count.description: The count of recipients in this list. This is not included on creation of segments.

list_id.description: The list id from which to make this segment. Not including this ID will mean your segment is created from the main contactdb rather than a list.

conditions.description: The conditions for a recipient to be included in this segment.

recipient_count.description: The count of recipients in this list. This is not included on creation of segments.

field.description: When applicable, this property value will be the field that generated the error.

help.description: When applicable, this property value will be helper text or a link to documentation to help you troubleshoot the error.

id.description: When applicable, this property value will be an error ID.

OnBehalfOf.name: on-behalf-of
OnBehalfOf.description: The `on-behalf-of` header allows you to make API calls from a parent account on behalf of the parent's Subusers or customer accounts. You will use the parent account's API key when using this header. When making a call on behalf of a customer account, the property value should be "account-id" followed by the customer account's ID (e.g., `on-behalf-of: account-id <account-id>`). When making a call on behalf of a Subuser, the property value should be the Subuser's username (e.g., `on-behalf-of: <subuser-username>`). See [**On Behalf Of**](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/how-to-use-the-sendgrid-v3-api/on-behalf-of) for more information.

BearerAuth.description: Twilio SendGrid requires you to authenticate with its APIs using an API key. The API key must be sent as a bearer token in the Authorization header.
